projects.title: In vitro effect of direct current electrical stimulation on rat mesenchymal stem cells differentiation.
projects.description: The research component of my Masters studies focus primarily on evaluating the effects of DC electrical stimulation on osteogenic differentiation of rat MSC by measuring the level of marker gene-expression. This will enable us to study the feasibility of combining electrical stimulation and tissue-engineering methods to improve current treatments or develop new treatments for patients suffering with large tissue defects.

contributors.headline: Biomedical engineer | AI in Biological Sciences | Big data and Image analysis | Scalable ML/DL in production | Agile and creative

projects.title: Mathematical Modelling of Adherent Tissue Culture cells
projects.description: Mathematical modelling gives a chance for obtaining conclusions for instance that are difficult to measure by experiments. The models can be investigated directly yielding general insight into their potential behaviors. Within this broad outline, many different models were made to reconstruct molecular anatomy (static modeling) or molecular physiology (dynamic modeling) and simulate them using computer in such a way that when these cellular events occur (Ordinary differential equations)), where they occur (Partial differential Equation), and how frequently they recur (Stochastic Differential Equation). Reviewing and analysis of these different mathematical models of adherent tissue culture cells under in-vitro conditions will emphasize on how mathematical modelling will contribute towards medical research in Applied Sciences Universities. This not only provides deep understanding about various techniques for modelling but also gives a brief note on the potential applications and technical difficulties associated with it.

projects.title: Isolation & transfer of halo-tolerance gene from Bacillus cereus (BFE 5400) to Brassica oleracea
projects.description: This study aims at improving the salinity tolerance (environmental stress) of plants (tolerance upto 12% of NaCl) by utilizing the inherent halo tolerance of Bacillus cereus FE 5400 (GenBank Id: GU2500442.1), a soil dwelling pathogen by genetically engineered them which thereby enable them to grow at high salt concentration.

projects.title: In-Situ Mutagenesis in Keratinolytic Bacteria and their Applications
projects.description: Poultry Industry in India is facing major trouble due to shortage of quality feed to the poultry. Feathers from the slaughtered chickens are ideal source of protein feed for the young chicks. To extract it, we use keratinolytic Bacteria from places near slaughter house.

projects.title: Phyto-Chemical Screening and its Anti-oxidant assaying of Cumarin in Euphatorium triplinerve and its Isolation Using HPLC
projects.description: Euphatorium triplinerve, a common weed in India has enormous utilities in Ayurveda and Siddha medical treatments. Cumarin, an active phyto-chemical has significant anti-aging and anti-microbial properties. The study involves analyzing and isolating this active component from the plant tissue.

▪ Establishing ETL pipeline for Big data acquisition and testing ML Algorithms.

profile_positions.title: Research Associate

company.name: Heinrich Heine Universität Düsseldorf - Lehrstuhl für BWL, insb. Management

profile_positions.description:
▪ Performed Molecular cloning, gene knockout, point mutation via Overlap PCR, DNA/RNA sequencing, and corresponding BL21 protein expression.
▪ Worked in projects involving sex determination, embryogenesis, and S2 cell culture in Drosophila melanogaster  (ISO 13485 quality standards).
▪ Trained in genetic model development, and imaging ( 2D/3D Confocal microscopy, Live-cell Imaging) with Lucia STELLARIS.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Work focused on analyzing the effects of electrical stimulation and its cytotoxicity on stem cells which can be used for clinical treatments of bone and soft tissue defects. The Tasks include,

▪ Performed 2D rat mesenchymal stem cells (rMSCs)culture under BSL-2 aseptic conditions (ISO 15189 quality standards).
▪ Osteogenic markers gene expression by qPCR and ANOVA.
▪ Used MS Excel, FIJI, and other open-source tools to automate some aspects of the project, Eg., Design and Implementation of Excel macros for molecular gene expression studies for faster and error-free data acquisition, processing, and statistical analysis.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher

profile_positions.description:
• Mathematical modeling and error validation in MATLAB.
• Studied the inter-relation between various cellular models of adherent tissue culture cells.
• Investigated the benefits and drawbacks of different mathematical models.
▪ Documented the human factor in designing automated experiments for downstream processing.
• Image quantification by thresholding-based processing with Open-Source tools.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

profile_positions.description:
Worked in Nano-Research Group. The Tasks include,

▪ Standardized the process of biological magnetic nanoparticles synthesis, operational safety, and instrumentation.
▪ Increased efficiency of Magnetic Liposomes synthesis and substrate (drug) encapsulation by modified Thin Film Hydration Technique.
▪ Additional duty is to improve quality by periodic revision of GLP documents of the Laboratory and implementation of SOP protocols.

profile_positions.description:
